name: K2-243
scenarioDescription:
The K2-243 Exoplanetary System

K2-243 is a star with 1.29 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.39 times its radius. It is located 878.01 light years away from the solar system.

K2-243 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-243 b

K2-243 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.54 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-243.

The mass of K2-243 b is 6.21 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-243 b is 2.17 that of Earth. At 6.21 Earth masses, K2-243 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

K2-243 c

K2-243 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 24.95 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-243.

The mass of K2-243 c is 5.12 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-243 c is 2.01 that of Earth. At 5.12 Earth masses, K2-243 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-243, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by K2.
